item.title: The hartebeest resembles the Mantis
item.summary: The hartebeest's head resembles that of |kaggen (the Mantis), so it feels itself to be 'Mantis's thing'. Some remarkable superstitions concerning the Hartebeest, whose head is said to resemble that of the Mantis; and also a curious charm made from the foot of the Hartebeest, and used by Bushman women for their children as a protection against the Mantis (L V.-6. 4414 rev.-4418 rev.).
item.comments: 1) See The hartebeest and the eland belong to the Mantis and More about the hartebeest and A mother's prohibitions with regard to the hartebeest and her child and The Mantis turned into a hartebeest, 2) This story is found in Book V-6
